Title.evidence: OBJECTIVE: To investigate the accuracy of a ventricular catheter guide assisted by a simple mobile health application (mhealth app) in a multicenter, randomized, controlled, simple blinded study (GAVCA study).

Trial_Design.evidence: multicenter, randomized, controlled, simple blinded study

Participants.evidence: In total, 139 eligible patients were enrolled in 9 centers.

Intervention.evidence: To investigate the accuracy of a ventricular catheter guide assisted by a simple mobile health application (mhealth app)

Objective.evidence: OBJECTIVE: To investigate the accuracy of a ventricular catheter guide assisted by a simple mobile health application (mhealth app) in a multicenter, randomized, controlled, simple blinded study (GAVCA study).

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary endpoint was the rate of primary cannulation of grade I catheter position in the ipsilateral ventricle.

Number_Randomised.evidence: In total, 139 eligible patients were enrolled in 9 centers.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The primary endpoint was reached in 70% of the guided group vs 56.5% (freehand group; odds ratio 1.79, 95% confidence interval 0.89-3.61).

Harms.evidence: No differences occurred in early ventricular catheter failure, complication rate, duration of surgery, or hospital stay.
